snippet: The first Haitian to get cholera at the onset of the 2010 epidemic was almost undoubtedly a 28-year-old mentally disturbed man from the town of Mirebalais, researchers reported Monday.
abstract: Report co-authored by Louise C Ivers and published in The American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene determines with near certainty that Haiti's 2010 cholera outbreak began with a mentally disturbed man in the town of Mirebalais who was bathing and drinking from a river contaminated with raw sewage.
lead_paragraph: The first Haitian to get cholera at the onset of the 2010 epidemic was almost undoubtedly a 28-year-old mentally disturbed man from the town of Mirebalais, researchers reported Monday.

headline.seo: Haitian Cholera Epidemic Traced to First Known Victim
headline.main: Haiti: Cholera Epidemic’s First Victim Identified as River Bather Who Forsook Clean Water
headline.print_headline: Cholera Epidemic’s First Victim Identified As River Bather Who Forsook Clean Water
